values:
Everything happening right now is either making me freak out in an amazing way or a terrible way and so many things are changing and i'm just.... AHHHHH

but it's good. you know?

And i'm starting to know what I want a bit more.

And I want this FUCKING JOB I'M APPLYING FOR. 

But I also have a list of things I want to accomplish that will make me happy. I am trying to find my true self and be the person i want to be. and.... I'm happy.
I graduated, bitches. hahahahah oh god what am i gonna do now.
Have I posted this? I probably have. Idk. Just looking at it.
I hope 2010 will be a good year! woo hoo hoo hooooo.

It is my birthday soon so I bought this threadless hoodie because it's (american apparel) on sale (for cheaper than if i just bought it from american apparel)

I will not look as cute in it as this asian girl here, but I wanted a new super bright colored hoodie.

Also, don't you love that camera on it? It is too good. Emilee said it was 'too phallic' but I don't think it's phallic enough.
 :P 



Will and I cooked some weird spicy amazing noodle stuff the other night. It was too hot, but it was.... good? 
Hot peppers and wine combined to make us feel damn weird.
Somewhat plesant until our stomachs started hurting.
Oh cooking.



I haven't been a very good artist lately.
Can't bring myself to do much work at all.
(AKA THE ONLY THING I'VE DONE SINCE AUGUST IS THAT PAINTING ABOVE. AND IT'S LIKE 14 X 18 INCHES BIG. WHATTTT)
Which is a MISTAKE
because i need to make stuff so i can apply to grad schools.

Ever since my grandma died, it's been kind of hard to get going.
I need the interia, i need to throw myself down a hill and into my work.
I have ideas, but they seem either difficult to excute because I am apathetic right now, or they are vague and dreamlike and won't come out of my head thru my hand without seeming really dumb (this is probably because they come out of me as terrible childlike drawings).

I have a little fortune cookie fortune here that says, "Well done is better than well said" which is more or less a great representation of my life right now.
I think i'm going to pin it up in my studio.
It was the best day ever.

"When the last living thing
Has died on account of us,
How poetical it would be
If Earth could say,
In a voice floating up
Perhaps
From the floor
Of the Grand Canyon,
"It is done.
People did not like it here.''

-Kurt Vonnegut

Friend Kari took this picture of me in part of my cubby... the shelf part, not the work desk part... I just don't have many pictures of me in the studio, which is funny, because i am almost always there.

lil watercolor.
gonna make ex libris (-es?  libri?)

I usually think these writer's block things are silly but...

That all depends, doesn't it?
One of our most favorite topics of conversation when Megan and I were living together in the dorm.

They're both cute.

But, yeah, Bret. I'm more fond of Bret. 
I mean, the angry dance!!!

Been taping the new episodes, need to watch them....

In painting last semester. 
They are very tiny.

It's not really narrative. I mean, a little. in my own head, but not in reality.


 

Once Upon A Time


Fox Bones Tells A Story


Over there clouds mountains and trees


Oceans of Criticism


Epic Battles, last stands, and sexual metaphors


 


Turtles.



It's narrative in a way that the relgious illustrated illuminated manuscript is narrative if you took away all the words.

If that makes any sense



spamming your friends page with pictures. sry.

I hate having to write it so much that I pretty much used Godwin's Law in the first paragraph.


...but the minimalists are nazis!!!


:)

edit:
....now that i think about it, i should probably change it. 
Calling Donald Judd a nazi probably isn't a really good way to get an okay grade on this paper. 
In fact, I think it shows that I don't have an arguement for not liking him, other than that I don't like him.

...What? The title of the paper is supposed to be 'I hate it!'

"The days that drip like an open sewer. "

Drawing, phototransfer, woodcut, thread.

I'm not sure if it's actually supposed to be a sewer or a sun or what...

Do you remember the sketch for this?
...The paper I did it on isn't very good. Lowish weight drawing paper. Not meant for watercolor or gouache.
Anyway.
Dung beetles, someone burning bag worms, a tree, some foxes, some people....
Some gouache, chalk, and pencil.


This is Sisyphus!

I'm actually really really really proud of this little painting.
It really means something to me.
and it's not being weird to be weird. All those things mean something. 
I mean, It makes sense to me. I'm just kind of a surrealist. Only I try to be a little more genuine.
I always felt like the surrealists were a bit... 

I want to tell stories.
If you understand them or not? eh. That's not my business.
Or at least it isn't right now.

To be short, it's about frustration.
How sisyphus rolled the ball up the hill every day, and how he kept having to do that day in and day out, with no improvement or change.
Frustration and how you attack yourself and other people. sometimes. I know i do...




...


I plan to make a drypoint of it, and use it to make watercolor monoprints with, because i'm really unhappy with the paper quality, but still too in love with it ot let it go.
Also, i can use it for thesis then.
But damn, it's gonna be a big dry point.
Sometimes all you need is your dog. and everything that is bad or annoying or disheartening or sad? He will cuddle it away.

What the hell, the internet? 
What? 

<lj-embed id="4"/>

America got rickrolled by cartoon newtork float.

Why did i deny Bright Eyes for so long?
I mean, how good is Cassadega? 

This is my informal apology for those two artists in high school I refused to like. 
Maya, Conor, I'm sorry. I was wrong. 
Was it pride or bad taste? We'll never know. (*cough* it was both *cough*)
(Or was it that I was too in love with TMBG to have any love left over? Probably not.)

Is my pennance that i actually pay real life money for Arular or Fevers and Mirrors?  
Maybe. 
But if you know me, you'll know that if i end up at CD central I will buy Belle and Sebastian's BBC Sessions. 
You cannot deny that obvious truth. 

Also, did you know M.I.A is having a baby? Whaaat?  
Also,  is anyone else kind of suprised at how popular she's gotten? 
Galang on a car commercial is one thing, paper planes everywhere is something else. 
I mean. I guess society does sometimes like good things. 
But if I ever hear Paper Planes at somewhere where it is obviously out of place again, I will destroy everyone. 
or actually, i'll sit there and give whatever soroity girl that screams, 'oh god i love this song' the evil eye, my friends will roll their eyes reminding me that i'm being the elitist bitch I am.
Especially since I don't like M.I.A. like a crazy person. I'm a casual fan. 
But it is still kinda annoying, right? 




Also, if Maya and Conor had a baby, would it grow up to be the hottest thing ever? Discuss.

Hey, so i painted this...




In case you wanted to look at it with your eyes.
Very Marc Chagall, yeah? 
It was oil bars. I'm not crazy about them....
But in general, I like this painitng.


I've also started on a drawing for the next project.

In case you wanted to look at that with your eyes as well.



going to work on it more pencil wise, then go back with gouache.
I'm actually.... really excited about this drawing.
It's the first time i've felt like i've done something.... real? in a while.

Not real, more like. I know what it is, i know what it means. It's catharsis and such.

Also, i love to draw foxes? 


Also, i'm much happier after talking to my printmaking teacher and my friend Jamie.
All will be okay.

Milkteeth

At critique someone thought it was great that I forgot to center the image. Since he found it so playful, he thought it inhanced that quality.
but we know better.
The really frustrating thing about art is how scanning or photographing it makes it look.

So, if you didn't know me in 2005, I had a sketchbook that was kind of like a comic journal.

I don't really do it anymore because I am lazy, but also because I feel that my sketchbook is journal enough, if you could read it correctly.

Anyway.
I was looking thru it today and thought I'd post this one as it seems appropiate for the week we are living in.
and my love for non-sequitars like...
Polka music and stoplights.
I know that i thought of all those things that day in context of what my dad said, but I can't remember why. Which is the nice thing about that journal....

(My mom bought me that Al Franken book. The most random Christmas present I've ever gotten. No really, he has the biggest man crush on Obama. You should've read it. hehe.) 


Aaaaannnnnd, this comic journal thing isn't really conductive to having friends. You kind of don't have time to make a journal of your day if you have friends. It's really also not a great way to protray yourself.

But sometimes I do wish I still did it.

This one isn't from the main project, but instead from the 'for fun' roll.



Hands to the sky, this is her favorite alley.

This photo is the metaphor for how she is one of my favorite people.

It also kind of reminds me of this music video.
and so, it was the most enjoyable Halloween since my childhood.

I thought this picture was the one to post because it's Halloween.

I'm going to have to reprint this photo. Some unknown chemicals spilled on it after the fact.

But for now, I have fall break.



Oh dear, Oh deer.

I'll post the pictures from my photo projects over a series of days. I'm too lazy to do it all at once.







God help us all when she wears three days worth of eye-liner.

Kids in the Richmond/Lexington Area:

This cool thing is tonight ( http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003872738 ) : 
Elephant 6 holiday surprise show. 
It's at the Red Mile in lexington, sponsored by WRFL and is free. It's at 8:30.  

Morgan said the Bloomington show was good, so I'm going.

Thought I'd post.... even tho I guess there are only 2 or 3 people who fit the description of "Kids in the Richmond/Lexington Area". 
OH WELL. 

I"M EXCITED. 

<3

It's days like these that I just want to sit in and draw. It's a chilly, sleepy day. 
My room gets great light.
Listening to Of Montreal and drawing things that never were. 

Stupid English Night Class.

Here is a watercolor.



I like Sparklers. and drawing/painting bloby things like smoke.

Not a very good photograph of it. But you know how that is. Also, the watercolor isn't totally done. I need to make the farther figure a bit darker and also, give him facial features....
It's about 18x24, I think. I can't remember. Whatever the standard size of Reeves etching paper is.

You know what's awesome? Driving aimlessly with your friend  and crossing the river on a ferry in your car. It's tight.

So I was at Hastings yesterday with Sarah.
and found this:




I picked it up, thinking, "hehe,  Squirtle is gay." and because I'm a loser and I like looking at the pictures in  Pokemon books for children.
(What pokemon books aren't for children? None of them. Let us just pretend that I'm not a loser, k? )

Anyway.


Upon inspection:

.......





We find that Squirtle's pretty gay.
Charmander and Polywhirl are over there in the corner. Getting ready to take Squirtle to a gay bar, obviously.

....Squirtle. I choose you.
....?!
Nope, he's not there.
He just came out of his pokeball. ;D

---

Okay, obviously the story was probably more about getting him out of his shell.
Not being as shy and awkward.
Obviously something any person who is a pokemon fan will need help with at  a point in their lives. :)

But still.

STILL.

BWHAHAHAHA. YES.

What do you think?

I think I'm anxious, but I think I'm hopeful.

EDIT: Gosh, why so emo? It didn't mean to be. I'm actually in a really good mood.  But I still like my drawing. I like drawing me. :D

Some good news.
I was accepted into my school's Bachelors of Fine Arts program in Painting and Printmaking.
I only get the one degree, but they'll let you explore two concentrations.

I needed some good news. The last few weeks have been crap, so this good news is comforting i guess.

My letter says

"During the portfolio review the committe made the following observations and suggestions:

...use of color is interesting. However, she needs to venture out of 'tube' colors...
...exhibits nice compositional skills...
...needs to 'lock down' her vision -- her work goes in too many directions...
...shouldn't rely on outline so much -- this needs to be discussed with her painting instructors."

Haven't posted art here in a while.
Here are some sketches.



Much love
Hope everyones Halloween was nice.

I should probably talk about these chips.
The roommate and I tend to shop for food at Big Lots.
This sometimes ends in us buying food items for the packaging alone.
The best examples for this are a brand of chips marketed under the name 'Rap Snacks'.

From the name alone you should infer that the chips are hip hop related, and you'd be right.
The two flavors that the Big Lots nearby has are 'Sour Cream and Onion' and "Southern Crunk Barbeque'.
Southern. Crunk. BBQ.
"But, Lindsay, how can chips be crunk?", you ask.
Well, they can't.



But I will admit.
They're pretty tasty. I know you probably don't believe me. Megan and I have bought... I dunno,  at least a dozen of them.

The Sour Cream ones suck.
I'm guess it is because they are not 'Crunk' enough.

Megan and I have almost bought the Big Lots out of the BBQ Crunk.
I went to the rap snacks' website to see if I could order more. I didn't see any Crunk BBQ, but it was an amusing few minutes anyway.
Thru googling I found some more rap snacks for you to enjoy looking at.


Who exactly is the target audience for this?
It's not me, but I've probably bought more Rap Snacks than most people.
I hope Big Lots gets another shipment in, or else I'll have to go without!
:D

So, how lazy am I? This is supposed to be my art blog!
So, here are some paintings I've done lately.... I'm linking them to my DeviantArt, because I'm so damn lazy as of late.
I'm so sorry that the photographs of the paintings suck.
I'd bad at photographing paintings. Obviously.


Elephant and Crab by ~rinziiart on deviantART

Friends will notice that my stuffed animal, the existential crab is in this still life, as is my elephant statue I've had ever since I was little. Also my flute and my plant, Wally Funk. 
The assignment was to do a still life with non-real colors. Like, most of the objects in that painting are bright red in real life. I'm not very unhappy with the painting, but the elephant half of the painting really doesn't visually do anything, I think. I might go back in and change it sometime.


Childhood Best Friend Victrola by ~rinziiart on deviantART

This is based on a photograph I took of Morgan. The pose she had was just too great.
Anyway, there is also a victrola record player and an accordion in the painting too. In the bottom corner.
It's swirly and probably my best painting as of yet.
I like the way it turned out. :)

I've been really obsessed with Squeeze lately.
Well, not obsessed, but feeling a need to listen to this 'greatest hits' album I have of theres.
It has only brought me joy.
It came out of the complete blue, maybe some radio station was playing it in the background and they jumped into my head.
I could be listening to the new album I got, but no.
I want to listen to "If I Didn't Love You". Yep yep.

I've been watching too much TV lately.

Morgan gave me a Cat and Girl Sticker. My life has improved exponentially.

I just saw the new Die Hard movie with Joe and his friend, Walter.
..What do you mean, o rly? I <3 Bruce Willis, Justin Long and Timothy Olyphant, of course I saw it.
Don't be a hater. Stuff blew up. That's all I asked for.

ANYWAY>>>

I'm beginning to bring over stuff from my other art blog, so this can be a feed-like blog rather than... well... nothing.
So! Comics under the cut! They involve Chicago, Cake, James Ensor, Art, Penguins, a resturant in Indiana, Ennui, and birds being weird.
Teaser:


Big version here

The only problem with going on a trip with your friends right before sememster starts is that seeing your friends was the only thing driving you to go back to class... and if you've already seen your friends, well. Then it is just class.
A 8+ hour bus ride is generally fruitless
where we find that the lowest form of communication is not, in fact, blogging, but pictochat on the Nintendo DS. How many times can you draw fecal matter, genitalia, or animals in party hats and be amused? It turns out to be much longer than antipated.


A comic that mostly describes Fall 2006.
Something not all that different.
Maybe not true, but very close.
Big version here




Big version here
I suppose the only consolation is that we didn't stop in Gary, Indiana.

The cafeteria was a rather odd place, where we could never really figure out what the prices were. There was a 'Ginny Plate' for somewhere around five dollars, but the items were specially marked, and it was too late for our wallets when this was observed.

The only good thing to come out of the visit to Jonathon Byrd's cafeteria is that we found a fantastic flyer for an elvis impersonator.
Sadly, as informed by a high school friend, I'd already been here before. In middle school. Also when going to/coming from Chicago.


Big Version here
It actually wasn't an Art-gasam, so much, as Nick had described it.
An 'Art-gasam' would be my reactions to the Picassos and the Impressionists.
This was more a They Might Be Giants'-Gasam, which is twice as sad and geeky.
I'm not a huge fan of Ensor, myself. This comic is misleading.
I'm a much bigger more rabid fan of the band that sings about him.
You can read more of my thoughts on this topic and rothko here-> http://cloudyink.blogspot.com/2007/01/meet-james-ensor-because-they-might.html



big here
Penguins are disgusting creatures.
They may be very cute, but they are equally covered in each other's poo.
That Penguin evaded every chance to be clean that he got.
One of the keepers even went into the chamber and was cleaning some of the rocks with a hose, and he kept away from her. He never got sprayed. He never jumped in the water. He was content to walk about with one of his brethren's waste on his back.


 
big here
I think Birds are odd. I guess I like them. In nature.
They poo a lot.....

Okay okay okay! hope you enjoyed that, and sorry if you've seen these before.
:)

Dear Johnny Rotten. Don't get me wrong. You're a sex pistol, and you know, that's awesome. But I have to let you know. I've seen your picture in the new rolling stone. and... you look like a potato. Anyone who would write this to the rock and roll hall of fame has my love but... potato. It is not quite as horrifying as this business: but... yeah... take care, Lindsay
